alert.note: Alert for Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 2:58PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Henry, northeastern Houston and southwestern Early Counties through 445 PM EDT/345 PM CDT/... At 358 PM EDT/258 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ashford, or 9 miles northeast of Cottonwood, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Headland, Blakely, Dothan, Kinsey, Ashford, Cowarts, Webb, Columbia, Avon, Gordon, Jakin, Memphis, Saffold, Pansey, Sigma, Grandberry Crossroads, Enon, Wilson Mill, Rock Hill and Barber. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
